definition: at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Holidays fried fruit, but also with butter.
sentences.chinese: 逢年过节炸果子，也用酥油。

sentences.english: Shadow theatre became quite popular as early as the Song Dynasty when holidays were marked by the presentation of many shadow plays.
sentences.chinese: 皮影戏在宋代很盛行，逢年过节皮影戏的演出很多。

sentences.english: You received little red envelopes containing money on special occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在逢年过节时你总能收到红包。

sentences.english: Go to the company holiday party.
sentences.chinese: 要参加公司逢年过节举办的餐会。

sentences.english: During festivals he always comes to see us.
sentences.chinese: 逢年过节他总是回来看我们。

sentences.english: On New Year's Day and other festivals, I always go back home.
sentences.chinese: 小张逢年过节总会给家里打个电话。

sentences.english: In China, people may play the gong and the drum during the traditional festivals.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，人们在逢年过节时会敲锣打鼓。

sentences.english: Old Hao then became a regular guest at the Embassy on Chinese festival celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 于是老郝头逢年过节都被大使馆邀请出席招待会。

definition: to celebrate the Chinese New Year
to visit one's friends and relatives
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to pay respects during a festival
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
merchandise sold for Chinese New Year
